posts._title: Ken Loach – Play For Today: The Rank and File (1971)
posts.title: Play For Today: The Rank and File
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: When a pay discrepancy continues without any resolution, glass factory workers turn to their union for support. But when it is not forthcoming, they take things into their own hands.

posts.title: Monanieba
posts.excerpt: synopsis Repentance (Pokayaniye) features Avtandil Makharadze in a dual role. As Georgian mayor Varlam Aravidze, Makharadze is a strutting, arbitrarily cruel dictator, something of a composite Stalin and Hitler. Visually he very closely resembles Lavrentiy Beriya, Stalin’s right hander and one-time KGB chief. As Abel, the mayor’s son, Makharadze finds himself in the middle of …

posts._title: Elena Gorfinkel – Lewd Looks: American Sexploitation Cinema in the 1960’s (2017)
posts.title: Lewd Looks: American Sexploitation Cinema in the 1960’s
posts.excerpt: Lewd Looks: American Sexploitation Cinema in the 1960’s by Elena Gorfinkel Paperback: 352 pages Publisher: University Of Minnesota Press; 1st edition (Oct. 15 2017) Language: English ISBN-10: 1517900174 ISBN-13: 978-1517900175 The untold story of the American sexploitation film—a major development in screen sex in the decade before “porno chic”

posts._title: SABU – Ryu san AKA Mr. Long (2017)
posts.title: Ryu san
posts.excerpt: Long is a Taiwanese killer known for his sword skills. After Long fails a Tokyo mission, he moves to a small town where no one knows about him.

posts._title: Germaine Dulac – La cigarette AKA The Cigarette (1919)
posts.title: La cigarette
posts.excerpt: Quote: A Parisian museum director believes his wife has lost interest in him and so places a poisoned cigarette in the box on his desk – thus allowing chance to decide the moment of his death.

posts._title: Renato Castellani – Due soldi di speranza AKA Two Cents Worth of Hope (1952)
posts.title: Due soldi di speranza
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: The story concerns the romance between Carmela and Antonio. Faced with the hostility of their parents, they symbolically shed themselves of all responsibilities to others in a climactic act of stark-naked bravado.

posts._title: Victor Fleming – Gone with the Wind (1939)
posts.title: Gone with the Wind
posts.excerpt: Gone With the Wind boils down to a story about a spoiled Southern girl’s hopeless love for a married man. Producer David O. Selznick managed to expand this concept, and Margaret Mitchell’s best-selling novel, into nearly four hours’ worth of screen time, on a then-astronomical 3.7-million-dollar budget, creating what would become one of the most …

posts._title: Cyril Collard – Les Nuits fauves aka Savage Nights (1992)
posts.title: Les Nuits fauves
posts.excerpt: Quote: Adapted from director Collard’s own novel, Les Nuits fauves won the filmmaker a French César for Best Debut Director just days after he died of AIDS-related illness (the film took four Césars, including Best FIlm, in 1993).

posts.title: Les berceaux
posts.excerpt: Here is the text for the poem by Sully Prudhomme that the song is based on: Le long du Quai, les grands vaisseaux, Que la houle incline en silence, Ne prennent pas garde aux berceaux, Que la main des femmes balance. Mais viendra le jour des adieux, Car il faut que les femmes pleurent, Et …

posts._title: Elem Klimov – Pokhozhdeniya zubnogo vracha AKA Adventures of a Dentist (1965)
posts.title: Pokhozhdeniya zubnogo vracha
posts.excerpt: Description: A comedy about a young dentist, who becomes well-known in his town but suddenly loses faith in himself. — (imdb review) A masterful, pro-elitist, Tatiesque film from Elem Klimov, 22 April 2006 Author: Niffiwan from Toronto, Canada This is story about a dentist with the talent of painlessly extracting teeth, and what happens to …
